intro: Papuacalia saruwagedensis, commonly known as the Saruwagede lily, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in cool, moist environments, often in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces a tall, slender stem that supports its delicate blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
